Apply a Function to Each Sequence Element

Source: R/30-api-flexseq-seq-apply.R
seq_apply.Rd

Maps `f` over elements of a `flexseq` and returns a new `flexseq`. Traversal is linear, and rebuild uses standard tree construction.

Usage

seq_apply(x, f, preserve_monoids = FALSE, ...)

Arguments

x

A `flexseq`.

f

Function applied to each element.

preserve_monoids

Logical; when `TRUE`, carries all input monoids to the output. When `FALSE` (default), output keeps only invariant monoids (`.size`, `.named_count`).

...

Additional arguments passed to `f`.

Value

A `flexseq` with transformed elements.

Examples

x <- as_flexseq(1:5)
seq_apply(x, function(v) v * 10)
#> FingerTree <size=5, named=no>
#>   monoids: none
#> 
#> [[1]]
#> [1] 10
#> 
#> [[2]]
#> [1] 20
#> 
#> [[3]]
#> [1] 30
#> 
#> [[4]]
#> [1] 40
#> 
#> [[5]]
#> [1] 50
#> 

xn <- as_flexseq(setNames(as.list(1:3), c("a", "b", "c")))
seq_apply(xn, function(v) v + 1)
#> FingerTree <size=3, named=yes>
#>   monoids: none
#> 
#> $a
#> [1] 2
#> 
#> $b
#> [1] 3
#> 
#> $c
#> [1] 4
#>
